attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Overrides the project description

attributes.name: upload
attributes.description: Hash that contains the information to upload the exported project to a web server

attributes.name: upload[url]
attributes.description: The URL to upload the project

attributes.name: upload[http_method]
attributes.description: The HTTP method to upload the exported project. Only PUT and POST methods allowed. Default is PUT

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

apis.name: Import a file
apis.description: To upload a file from your file system, use the --form argument. This causes cURL to post data using the header Content-Type: multipart/form-data. The file= parameter must point to a file on your file system and be preceded by @. For example:

attributes.name: namespace
attributes.description: The ID or path of the namespace to import the project to. Defaults to the current user’s namespace

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the project to be imported. Defaults to the path of the project if not provided

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: The file to be uploaded

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Name and path for new project

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.description: If there is a project with the same path the import overwrites it. Default to false

attributes.name: override_params
attributes.description: Supports all fields defined in the Project API

apis.name: Import a file from a remote object storage
apis.description: This endpoint is behind a feature flag that is enabled by default.

attributes.name: namespace
attributes.description: The ID or path of the namespace to import the project to. Defaults to the current user’s namespace.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the project to import. If not provided, defaults to the path of the project.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: URL for the file to import.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Name and path for the new project.

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.description: Whether to overwrite a project with the same path when importing. Defaults to false.

attributes.name: override_params
attributes.description: Supports all fields defined in the Project API.

apis.name: Import a file from AWS S3

attributes.name: namespace
attributes.description: The ID or path of the namespace to import the project to. Defaults to the current user’s namespace.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the project to import. If not provided, defaults to the path of the project.

attributes.name: region
attributes.description: AWS S3 region name where the file is stored.

attributes.name: bucket_name
attributes.description: AWS S3 bucket name where the file is stored.

attributes.name: file_key
attributes.description: AWS S3 file key to identify the file.

attributes.name: access_key_id
attributes.description: AWS S3 access key ID..

attributes.name: secret_access_key
attributes.description: AWS S3 secret access key.

apis.name: Import status
apis.description: Get the status of an import.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user
